Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a fish to show what it needs to live, like water.
The student can draw and label the habitat where the fish lives, such as a pond, river, or ocean.
The student can include and label other living things like plants or animals that also live in the fish's habitat.
The student can show and label resources in the drawing that help the fish survive, like water and plants.
The student can illustrate the relationship between the fish and its environment, such as how the fish swims in the water.
The student can identify and label parts of the system that includes the fish, its habitat, and the resources available.
The student can demonstrate how the parts of the system work together to meet the fish's needs.
